title: The 100% #1 way to get rid of Miss Fortune Support....
body: Play support yourself, don't pick her. Problem solved. Less posts on it. Shorter queue times. You win.

replies.body:
1. Hope the enemy team picks MF support.
2. Pick anyone other than Zyra.
3. Enjoy freelo
Or pick Zyra anyway cuz ppl don't realize it's an MF and Ashe combo.

It can be other carries, so long as they have good enough lockdown for MF's ult.
So Varus and Jhin could also work. Possibly Kennen, too. Caitlyn and Jinx could work but to a lesser degree, since their CC relies on the enemy misplay.
It would be funny to see a vayne tumble into a caitlyn trap against a caitlyn mf bot lane
It would be funny to see a Vayne tumble in to a Caitlyn trap, period.
It would really be better to pick MF ADC and a cc support, because cc supports fit the meta a little more than cc AD carries

Perhaps, but MF support was picked mainly for the laning phase to counter enemy lane.
There was a high utility champion (Karma) in the mid lane, which rounds out the team comp. There may be other factors why MF support was picked too that I'm overlooking.

She was picked in worlds because her synergy with Ashe allowed them to counter Zyra as well as transition into a stronger mid and late game. Her ult is always good in teamfights and a secondary adc does well in this "no-cc-just-play-a-carry" meta.

>"no-cc-just-play-a-carry" meta.

Why I always play CC heavy champions if at all possible.
Good. CC wins games.
All these viewers must be expecting something more dramatic.
Believe me, I play weird supports (Jhin, Gragas, Singed, Lee and J4 are a few of my favorites), but at least I look at their kit and see if they could actually be used as a support, MF is far from it

Miss Fortune support is primarily useful for applying maximum stacks of The Black Cleaver at the beginning of a fight so that the rest of her team get a huge damage spike. 

It's different from the typical peel function of a support. Doesn't make it bad.

You could just build black cleaver on braun or alistar if you REALLY needed it.

You have more CC, Damage, Tank. Pretty much everything.

MF support is useful against zyra and thats it.

You do NOT have more damage on alistar or Braum than you do on MF. MF is a carry. Her DPS is fantastic.

Alistar and Braum lack a way to stack Cleaver. All of their abilities deal magic damage.

MF hits the whole team with 6+ stacks of physical damage over 2 seconds. It's an immense offense buff.

Yea ADC MF is a carry. Support MF isnt.

Where is support mf getting all this farm? IS she not buying wards?

http://champion.gg/champion/MissFortune/Support

Shes currently the lowest winrate support in the game.

And the 18th worse in performance.

And she doesnt even do the most damage. 3 other supports beat her in damage.

THere are LITERALLY 0 reasons to play MF support.


Also if MF hits the whole team with her ult they suck... hardcore.

Champion.gg only tracks info for Plat and above. That has nothing to do with me.

And yes, I play against bad players. So does 85% of the playerbase. What's your point? 

My build is Spellthief's -> Eye of the Watchers->Ninja Tabi->Black Cleaver->Mortal Reminder->Duskblade of Drakthar->Infinity Edge
I guess pro players are just a bunch of idiots, right?

Tournaments dont have the same meta as solo q.

And she was nowhere near the highest pick/ban...

Wait... she was only in 3 games...

THats not pick/ban. SHe had 8% presence rate...
braum doesn't apply full stacks of black cleaver onto all 5 enemeis within 3 seconds while also dealing alot of dmg

http://champion.gg/champion/MissFortune/Support

Shes currently the lowest winrate support in the game.

And the 18th worse in performance.

And she doesnt even do the most damage. 3 other supports beat her in damage.

THere are LITERALLY 0 reasons to play MF support.
It's a situational pick; not a blind pick.
I'd love to add you to "Off Meta Support Mains" club once clubs are back up :/

ehhhhhh... I feel like they've been meta for quite a long time.
Annie is pretty situational, but Lux with a lot of early mana regen is a poking nightmare.

funny part is aside from being a Sona main. i love doing off meta supports really or something uncommon like a support with {{summoner:12}}  or {{summoner:1}}  (normally i forget but its fun) like but i played plenty of support {{champion:134}} {{champion:150}} {{champion:17}} {{champion:22}} {{champion:51}} {{champion:103}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:54}} AP{{champion:39}} {{champion:33}}  back in s5-s6 really, it was really fun to throw people off with those oddball picks and win lane while being a second carry.
do you build jhin supp tanky or ap-ish?

Utility support items and use his Flourish and Curtain Call to support from extreme ranges with the slow and root while laying traps, here is my average build

thanks

MF support is pretty popular. Having an off meta pick played by a pro often legitimizes the pick to some extent, but that's not the whole story here.

The whole story is that if you play MF support, you start off as a support and then become the team's second (or third, or fourth) marksman later on. Unlike mage and tank supports who become more utility focused as time goes on, MF support becomes a carry; albeit one that's a bit lacking in gold compared to the actual ADC.

Basically, people are playing MF support because they got matched as a support but want to be a carry, and the pro pick gives them a convenient excuse to play marksman #2 instead of a traditional support.

Riot should be taking notes here. Perhaps it's time for a new champion designed to be a support carry.

or because ur team decided full AP team comp is the best idea ever

but then even Trundle (honor-of-mention: Sion) support can do fantastic job to fill up the hole in the team comp in late game so **_for the love of god dont play mf support unless teamed with ashe adc and against zyra support_**
She actually only has a 43% winrate against zyra.

prob cuz ashe adc wasnt in there in most of the games.
and in games where adc ashe was there, win rate is still low cuz zyra wasnt in most of those games either.

to rephrase it: mf supp requires both presence of ally ashe adc and enemy zyra support to be good

Or maybe the adc just tilted from the beginning instead of actually trying.
Probably like most people who play this game who get tilted too hard by a first blood.

She actually only has 1 winning lane. ANd thats against alistar at 50.80 winrate
....what about her counters Alistair? I'm genuinely confused. Ali ult+W should completely shut her ult down, and his E should strongly offset her poke.

> [{quoted}](name=Darien Juranas,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=57BEluhK,comment-id=000f00000000,timestamp=2016-10-27T21:02:35.352+0000)
>
> ....what about her counters Alistair? 

The sample is 140 games, which is pretty small.

Although I imagine she just harasses alistar from safe distance with her E and the cow can't do much about it, other than maybe flash-engage
If she uses E for harass, she's gonna go OOM real quick, specially since Alistar can counter that with his own E.

Alistar will moo, I mean oom pretty fast as well. And as far as I know, Miss Fortune maxes E first (and let's not forget that it procs all stacks of spellthief's edge at once for 30 additional damage), whereas Alistar leaves his at rank 1 for a long time. Early on, before he can all in her, she can even harass him with autoattacks a lot.
If Miss Fortune plays it wisely, doesn't overextend, and doesn't ult when there's a threat of Ali interrupting it, I don't think she's at a huge disadvantage here.

Except as you noted, she has to arrange her entire playstyle around him. And since support MF really doesn't bring anything but damage to the table, she should be maxing Q first, not E.

No one's saying she can't win against him, the question is what natural advantage she might have on him.
